intro: Bifaria pancheri, commonly known as the Indian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to the arid regions of India and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It has succulent leaves that help it retain water in its dry habitat. Bifaria pancheri is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
